ygData.subject: Re: skills and points
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, I am a master in fishing and yes granted i do it when I have nothing better to do, but its food, its free and works really good in keeping stamina up
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, I am a master in fishing and yes granted i do it when I have
nothing better to do, but its food, its free and works really good in
keeping stamina up in a fight.


>From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] skills and points
>Date: Wed, 25 Aug 1999 22:16:28 GMT
>
>From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
>
>So what are they saying? That I can't be Bill Dance? I could see it
>now, "Ergo, professional fisherman." Fishing is a fairly worthless
>skill, anyway. Just a way to kill some time when you're waiting on
>the boat.
>
>Ergo 13th level cleric of tunare
>
>
>>
>>From: Buddy Cole <douglas@...>
>>
>>On Wed, 25 Aug 1999, Curtis Bennett wrote:
>>
>> > From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
>> >
>> > Neat! Does the (level + 1) * 5 formula apply to things like begging,
>> > alcohol tolerance, and sense heading as well?
>> >
>>
>>*snippage of the entire thread to date*
>>
>>Yep - for non-combat-related skills, the formula of (lvl + 1) * 5
>>applies. Trade skills have no caps, with the exception of Fishing.
>>--
>>We cross our bridges when we come to them and burn them behind us,
>>with nothing to show for our progress but the memory of the smell
>>of smoke and the presumption that once our eyes watered.
>>
>>
